briefTitle: Web-based Smoking Cessation Program for Tribal College Students

armGroups.label: Internet-All Nations Breath of Life (I-ANBL)
interventionNames: Other: Internet-All Nations Breath of Life (I-ANBL)
Drug: Nicotine gum, Patch, or Lozenge or Zyban® or Chantix®

armGroups.label: Honoring the Gift of Heart Health
interventionNames: Other: Honoring the Gift of Heart Health
Drug: Nicotine gum, Patch, or Lozenge or Zyban® or Chantix®

interventions.name: Honoring the Gift of Heart Health
Nicotine gum, Patch, or Lozenge or Zyban® or Chantix®
otherNames: Nictotine Replacement Therapy (Nicotine gum, Patch, or Lozenge) or Pharmacotherapy (Zyban® or Chantix®)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Currently enrolled at Salish Kootenai College
* Have a valid telephone number and email address
* Willing to participate in all study components
* Willing to be followed-up for 6 months
* Self identifies as American Indian or Alaska Native
* Is a current smoker

Exclusion Criteria:

* Planning to leave college within next 6 months
* Medically ineligible as a result of screening questions

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence Abstinence
outcomeMeasures.description: self-reported and biochemically (salivary cotinine) verified point prevalence abstinence, defined as no smoking for the previous 7 days, at the 6-month follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cigarettes Per Day
outcomeMeasures.description: effect of intervention on the number of cigarettes smoked daily among those who continue to smoke at Month 6

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Quit Attempts
outcomeMeasures.description: comparison of the number of serious quit attempts between the two groups using Poisson regression

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Participated in All Sessions Over the Course of 6 Months.
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants who participated in all online sessions and study protocol procedures over the course of 6 months
